args.natural_language_statement: Every open set U in the real numbers is the union of an at most countable collection of disjoint segments (open intervals). Translate to Lean4: state a theorem Rudin_exercise_2_29 that for any U : Set ℝ, IsOpen U implies there exists a sequence f : ℕ → Set ℝ of pairwise disjoint open sets with U = ⋃ n, f n. End the Lean statement with := by sorry. Import Mathlib at the top.

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Set

/-- Rudin exercise 2.29: Every open set U in ℝ is the union of an at most countable collection
of disjoint open intervals. Here we state a version: there exists a sequence of pairwise
disjoint open sets whose union is U. -/
theorem Rudin_exercise_2_29 {U : Set ℝ} (hU : IsOpen U) :
  ∃ f : ℕ → Set ℝ, (∀ n, IsOpen (f n)) ∧ (∀ i j, i ≠ j → (f i ∩ f j) = ∅) ∧ (U = ⋃ n, f n) := by sorry
